trial_identification.studytitle: Effectiveness of an intervention program to improve the nutritional quality of lunchboxes in elementary school children
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Comparison of an intervention program to improve the nutritional quality of home prepared lunchboxes in second and sixth grade elementary school children

interventions.interventions: The intervention will be based on information about healthy food and nutrients that should be included in the lunchbox. This will be implemented during an eight week period. At the beginning of the study the food and nutrient content of the lunchboxes will be assessed. Posters for children and parents with information to improve the content of school lunchbox will be displayed at the school and leaflets will be distributed to the parents and their children. During the first week, the importance of drinking water will be emphasized; in the second week, it will be focused on the inclusion of fruits and vegetables, in the third week, how to prepare healthy foods will be showed, and in the fourth week, information about prepared dishes and unhealthy foods will be given. The following four weeks letters with menus for breakfast, lunchbox contents and healthy food will be sent home. After the eight weeks of intervention the food and nutrient content of the lunchboxes will be assessed.
interventions.comparator: The control group receives no intervention.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Reduce the number of unhealthy lunchboxes. Unhealthy lunchboxes that does not meet the guidelines of school snack recommend the Health Secretary in Mexico. Do not included; A) plain water, b) a portion of fruit or natural vegetable, c) prepared or commercial food containing approximately less than 250 kcal. For the data analysis of the information will be used the programs Excel 2010 and SPSS version 19.0 for Windows. Chi-square test will be used to see if there are differences between percentages of unhealthy and healthy Lunchbox, fruits, vegetables and unhealthy food, water between the control group and group intervention, pre-and post-intervention and by sex and age groups.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Reduce the calorie content of lunchboxes For the analysis of lunch box contents using a food program Nutritionist Pro v 5.2
Increase the number fruits and vegetables, and plain water With a checklist will be registered the kind of food in the lunch box

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: second and sixth grade elementary school children
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: children with mental or physical disabilities, metabolic problems or cancer

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The objective of this project is to design and implement a program of nutritional educational guidance for parents, to modify the type and quality of food that sent to lunchbox at their children. At the same time reduce the number of unhealthy lunchboxes, calorie content, increase the number fruits and vegetables, and plain water.
